Lee Regular Fit Straight Leg Jeans

reviewer_comment: I unfortunately wasn't around during the time when all denim was a heavyweight fabric. Nowadays it seems like most denim retailers sell paper thin denim. And I am not a fan. So for a while I only work 501s. Until I actually decided to examine a pair of Lee Regular Straights. And if you're looking for a jean that is built tough with a heavyweight denim. These are it. I love that they tell you how many oz you're getting in each pair. I love the "lazy S" back pocket details and just the overall construction of these jeans.

All of my jeans have been Lee since college. I always bought them in a local store, but this time it did not have my size. I was overwhelmed by the choices on this site, but was smart enough to look at the stock keeping unit (i.e. item code) in my current jeans.

Lee jeans fit me perfectly and I needed a few spare pair. After going through about 20 pairs at the store looking for the right shade and size, I through up my arms and just decided to go online. Straight from Lee.com these jeans came in perfect condition and the whole process was easy and quick. Thanks Lee

These Lee classic cut fit perfect if you are an athletic body type and determine your sizing accurately. Small issue is the waistline need to come up slightly, because if you have any curve to your physique, it barely makes it to the proper waist position. Piggy bank look is now out in 2020 and looks dated, and nothing classic about it. Other than that small gripe these jeans have a great look and fit, hug body perfectly without being too tight, and look especially nice in color Orion. Small adjustment to the waist, (maybe add 1/2 in.) and you nailed the look.

I have been wearing Lee jeans for many years. I was never able to find size 35" waist in the stores here, so always had to go with 36". Now I have found 35 on your website at Lee.com and they fit well, however, it would be nice to be able to get a 29" leg length, which you do not make (35 - 29).

I have bought Lee jeans for several years. The two pair that I purchased most recently had noticeably crooked seams. I called customer service, which emailed me a shipping label. The replacement jeans arrived in about a week, and they were perfect. The company really stands behind its products, which is a definite plus.

I was looking for some new basic jeans, something that would be durable and hold up well. I purchased 4 pairs (different colors) of these Lee Regular Fit Straight Leg Jeans. They fit great, very comfortable and look great. I've used Lee jeans for many years and have never had an issue with their products.

I don't know if this is a quality control issue or not, but I believe the fit on these jeans are not consistent. My size is 36x29 and I bought three Lee jeans in different colors. Same size, different fits. One was perfect but the other two ended up feeling tight. I kept the hoping they would loosen up a bit, but it's something to consider before purchasing.

First time wearing them one of my loops that hold a belt in place was torn out. They snagged on a doorknob! Couldn't believe it. I had already washed them so I didn't try to return them. As I teenager or young adult lee jeans lasted forever. Now fabric is too light.

I buy the same size 32 waist jeans every time, but the last ones I bought I couldn't button. I just bought 33's just recently, and they're way too loose. What gives? Did someone change how long an inch is?

My husband has worn these jeans for years, but like everything else in our lives, the Corporation has decided to change the fit. These jeans are advertised as fitting at the waist, but this is no longer true. For those that have long waist, these jeans no longer fit like the previous jeans fit. Very disappointed in the new fit and had to return them.

I have multiple pairs of 'Lee Jeans Regular Fit' that I have purchased in the past. These 'Lee Jeans Regular Fit' are no where near the same quality. The fabric is much cheaper, lighter weight cotton . The length is way off & the overall fit is not the same. Looks like Lee sacrificed quality to increased profit margin. Shame

Glad i found you guys again...always wore your jeans over others, but was somehow convinced by others that different events call for different styles. Sorry i left. Have absolutely loved all of the jeans i've purchased, and will continue struggling through the less-than-responsive mobile site. That side of your e-biz needs some real work, but the jeans are awesome.

They are great for what they are, perfect. But, going forward I will look for something that fits a bit tighter in the thighs and butt. I do realize America is spreading in those areas but I can only wear them once before washing because they get a bit baggy. The first time after washing they are perfect. Also, I think if you made this style in a stretch version it would be the perfect jean for me, I could go down a size. Again overall, the three pair I bought are outstanding, and I suspect the fit will get better with age.
This is my dad's go to pants for everyday activities and when he works outside in the dirt. He's worn them for years and they're long lasting. Great present
I bought two pairs of blue jeans for my husband because he loves Lee Jeans so much! They fit him perfectly and they are the best in terms of durability!!
I ordered 2 pair at my normal size 36/34. These Jean's must run long. I guess I should have ordered 36/32. Am I able to exchange? They have been washed once.
Pepperwash finish is great for my tastes. Love the straight leg cut too. I've been wearing Lee for years now and they've always held up very well. I'll be back for yet another pair...

I've been wearing this style of jeans for a couple years fit me pretty well on my last order I noticed that they have changed quite a bit, the legs are wider and longer and baggier in the same sizeI have been wearing.
I have bought these many times. I am female but the men's jeans are better (e.g., 100% cotton). I just bought 2 for me and 2 for my brother, who also likes them

Lee always provides me with the right fit, style, and color selections. I highly recommend Lee jeans. I have owned many, many pairs. Never once have I complained.

Too bad you can't find these in the stores anymore. This Lee website is the only one that shows accurate colors AND denim weight. Runs circles around Levi's, which I wore for decades but are now no longer sewn properly.

It has always been the only choice for me. Lee comes out on top in every category jeans can be judged by me. Always without fail; quality, consistency in fit and wear, long lasting and tough. So happy this has been one of the constants in such a changing world where quality takes a second seat. Thank you so much.

Lee jeans are the best. My husband is a truckdriver so his jeans have to be comfortable but not loose so they don't cause a hazard and hold their color so he can wear them for other things. Lee always fit the bill. He's worn Lee jeans since I've known him and thats 39 years. I like them because they look good on him and they last forever. Good job!!

I have worn Lee regular fit jeans for decades and had loved them, but the latest ones I recently purchased disappoint me. I ordered them on line and immediately noticed they were way too loose in the waste. I returned them and ordered a few pairs in different sizes. They're "okay" but stretch out a bit while wearing them. I miss the previous way they were made, without so much stretch. Since I received them I've been searching everywhere for different brand of jeans that look similar but aren't stretchy like women's jeans. Also I like them in light blue and the only place I can find them in that color is on line.

The regular straight fit jeans that I purchased for my husband fit him perfectly. He told me that they are very comfortable to wear, made well and that the denim is a good all year weight. The jeans have been washed a few times since purchase and come out of the dryer looking great.

I had to take them to a local tailor to shorten inseam and taper the legs to get a uniform fit. When you order the same size and style you would think they would ALL fit the same. Sadly that was not the case. Have no idea where you have outsourced the sewing of this product, but they are lacking in quality control regarding size.

The same thing happens when I buy online from Lee's main competitor. Always. And, the material is thin. I've bought Lee jeans at two different times and they all fit perfect!

I have Lee and Levi jeans that are ten years old and older. The value came in the quality of the material, finish and they lasted for ever. While the finish is much the same today, both companies have moved to a product with lighter weight denim. Unfortunately, I expect that the life of my new jeans will be significantly shorter than my past experience. Overall I rate my Lee jeans as Good rather than Excellent for the reasons noted in this review.

I love Lee Jeans , especially the regular fit straight leg jeans. I have worn other top brands And they do not fit as well or look as good. These jeans even make me look slimmer, and at 58 years old,that is important. Ordering on Lee's website is convenient and easy . Jeans arrive quickly and packaged Beautifully. Love my Lee's!!!

Regular Fit Straight Leg Jeans are the only look and feel of "real jeans". Recently lost weight and had to rebuy 3 pairs with smaller waist. Six weeks later, I had to do it again!! Couldn't find 32x29 at my local store, so ordered them directly from the source. These are the only jeans for me. Much better than Levi... just saying.

I love the fit and the look. two minor complaints are the double black seem to fade too quickly and I wish they were pre-shrunk although, by my measurement the length comes about three quarters to one inch longer than ordered and shrink in a hot dryer about that much so it works out. But, try these jeans, you won't be returning them which, by the way, they make very easy to do with a return label.

I love Lee jeans for fit, comfort and durability and price. The blue ones always look great too. This brown pair is okay, but after one wash they got lines of discoloration. The grey pair that I bought last year did the same thing. The color bleeds and the jeans come out of wash with a permanent wrinkled look even though the dryer takes the actual wrinkles out, the color bleed makes the wrinkles look permanent. I think I'll wash my next pair of colored Lee jeans by hand for their first wash and air dry. After that I bet they'd wash fine.

I am 6' tall with a medium athletic build. I have long legs and a naturally high waist. I have been wearing Lee jeans since I was in junior high school and they continue to fit me well. They are durable and have a classic style for a clean, dressy casual look that goes well with a variety of year-round combinations of shoes and tops, like polos in the Spring/Summer and mock necks/sweaters in the Fall/Winter. Unbelievably, people on the street, in my office and at get-togethers marvel at them, asking me "what type of jeans are those?" or "where did you get them?". When I tell them they are Lee jeans that have been made in America for over 100 years, and they are available at many Army-Navys and department stores, they are dumbfounded! I also refer them to Lee's website and reinforce the overall value, especially now that many people have been brainwashed into paying anywhere from double the price to hundreds of dollars for "trendy" jeans, including frayed jeans with holes and baggy, low-hanging jeans for the "prison look".

I have purchased many pairs of Lee jeans over the years and the sizing has always been consistent. With this last purchase (waist size 38) these seemed incredibly tight versus previous pairs. Because of the previous success in sizing I went ahead and washed this pair prior to trying them on (my mistake). Would probably not buy online again due to not being able to try the fit before buying.

My husband loves these jeans and we hope that u will always continue to make them. He has been wearing them for years. Department stores do not carry all of the colors (or they are always sold out),and length 29 is hard to find as well. This is why I like to order them straight from the Lee website. Great variety and perfect size. Thanks Lee Jeans!

Bought these jeans in several colors for my son. I like that Lee offers so many color options and sizes, esp for tall (length 36) and waist measurements. Often you cannot find jeans in tall sizes with slim waist. Love the options of slim, relaxed, fits.

I bought 3 pair of these for myself in dark wash, gray and beige. I am 6 feet tall and need a 36 inch inseam. I have narrow hips so I love the straight cut. It's hard to find that length in the small waist sizes at the stores. Perfect fit, great quality and good price. Of course they look quite different on my figure than on that male model!! Trust me ladies, don't be afraid if you need that length.

My husband wears a 35"x32" and has very skinny legs. He also will not purchase anything with "stretch". So, this is it. The 35" waist is hard to find in stores but I love that we can order online and take advantage of sales and free shipping from time to time.

I was wandering in the wilderness for years, never happy with the jeans I was buying. And I tried them all. Except I didn't try Lee. Don't as me why...I just didn't. Now I have and I've never been happier. The fit of this model is perfect for me...from the waist to the ankle and everywhere in between. And the weight and quality of the denim and the workmanship is the best I've encountered. I immediately bought three pair just in case the world came to an end and I could get them again.

Although I felt the price was high for someone on a fixed income, I purchased 2 pair of these jeans. They are comfortable and easy care as they do not need to be pressed if taken out of dryer before completely dry and hung on a hanger. If they are as durable as they seem to be, I will consider the purchase as money well spent.

I have a pair of Lee jeans that I really like, but could not find them in stores and when I did, they did not have my size. Buying through Lee.com I got exactly what I wanted without having to drive around and they came directly to my door within a very short time. I feel very smart.

After putting up with diminishing quality and fit issues with my previous go-to jeans (Levi's 505) for many years, I decided to give these Lee's a try. reviewer_comment: The leg and bottom of the straight leg was changed and us now too baggy with no good replacement. Very disappointing.
I have been wearing Lee jeans since my college days and that was 50 years ago. Now as then the product fits perfectly and is an exceptional value.
Wear them everyday for almost all occasions. Only drawback is they run a little long. This may change with multiple washings.
Website was easy to navigate, all sizes available were shown, checkout was easy and delivery was not only free but quick.
been buying the same size for years and the new ones did not fit at all . to long and to big in the thigh.
One leg of the jeans was at least an inch longer than the other. They looked silly on me and I threw them out.
I'm very pleased with my purchase. I would recommend them to family and friends. In fact, I'm wearing a pair as of this review!
I have tried lots of jeans and found that lee jeans fit the best. Only Jean I have found with a 29 inch inseam. Keep up the good work.
I have not purchased LEE jeans in several years. Surprised they are really nice looking and fitting.

I don't know what the heck happened to Lee - Straight Leg - Regular Fit - Men's Jeans, but I'll need that answer before I ever buy another pair. I have three pairs of the jeans mentioned above, and have had them for about three years, and thought these were the last jeans I would EVER buy. They used to fit perfectly to my shape in the waist, legs, and seat. Now, the material seems to fit differently in those areas. I used to be a great customer and very satisfied with lee jeans, but I will have to look for a new company because Lee has completely lost my trust, and from the looks of this same type of review popping up on many different platforms, the trust of many of their FORMER customers. I could understand if Lee wanted to add a new style to their line to appeal to different buyers, but those of us that already felt comfortable with a trusted product should not have had that product changed without notice. This move truly shows how Lee feels about it's customers. BRING BACK THE OLD JEANS!!! p.s. I am 29 years old and this is not a rant that older people sometimes make about how things were better when they were younger. Things were better when Lee didn't mess up their jeans. p.p.s. There is a small tell between the Older version of reliable jeans, and the terrible new one. The older version has a Lee logo stitched near the right front pocket and no logo on the back pocket. The new, changed, and less desirable jeans have no Lee logo on the right front pocket and instead the logo has been placed on the left side of the upper seam of the rear right pocket. If you have a logo on the right backside pocket, your in for a disappointing product.

I ordered a pair of jeans (Regular fit, Straight leg) but each one has a different fitting. One was almost tight and the other one was very loose and short in length. Poor quality check. I used to order two jeans every year, though this one I ordered it a year ago and just tried it today for first time, it was total disaster and never expected it from Lee. For that matter the pairs I have ordered year by year have different fittings even though I order the same size, model. Fingers crossed I have ordered another pair now and waiting for it to be delivered. If fitting quality is bad, it's good bye to Lee from me. Inconsistent fitting, very bad.
I purchased for my husband who is very particle with his clothes.
They fit good and a good price.
They fit good after washing but they stretch out after wearing.
I have been buying Lee Jeans for many years. They are perfect for me. I will always be a customer.
I wear the product and it looks nice
Lee has a equal to better fit than Levis. The material Lee uses is far superior to Levis.
Wearing for relaxing and work. Solid. Thanks.
After 35 years, still wear Lee jeans. Other brands don't compare.
Size is very comfortable - glad to finally have a site to find 33/29

reviewer_comment: Bought 5 pair on line for the first time! Always had to search through the stores & try on everything because of the limited supplies in Lee jeans. Ended up buying other brand name in style or fit that was not my preferred choice. All 5 pair I bought on line fit perfectly and all styles and colors were available!!! I can't believe it took me so long to do this. All of my future jean purchases will be done here from now on.

I must say that I was a regular purchaser of Lee Regular Fit Straight Leg Jeans for years, but the last time I bought a pair, I was astonished to find how baggy the fit was and had to return it. Haven't bought a pair since and won't...unless Lee decides to go back to the old fit. Why it was changed, I'll never know.

Wow, what a surprise. A jean that actually fits in the waist based on the size stated. This is probably the first jean that I did not have to try on multiple pairs of the same size to find a correct fit. Excellent fit in seat and legs. The leg opening is also super - not oversize but just right. I would recommend deeper front pockets but that is minor..

I have a lot of Lee Jeans and they are the only brand I am comfortable in. The fit is good, the service is great. The only drawback is that I have to have them shortened after I receive them. I would really like Lee to accommodate more lengths so I wouldn't have to alter the jeans every time I order them.

BOTH PAIR OF JEANS WERE WRINKLED BEYOND BELIEF. THEY WERE IRONED BEFORE WEARING AND WERE STILL WRINKLED. I WORE BOTH PAIR TWICE. THEY WENT INTO THE WASH AND WERE IRONED AGAIN. THE WRINKLES WOULDN'T COME OUT. WHAT GIVES WITH THESE PANTS? THEY LOOK LIKE I'VE BEEN SLEEPING IN THEM FOR DAYS. TO BAD, BECAUSE OTHERWISE, THEY FIT GREAT.

I ordrered these on line because its impossible to find the regular classic fit with a 28 inseam so on line i can get 29 thankfully.I wish you would make more colors in 36x29 classic fit. I would love to get them for my boyfriend in the light blue demium.Also a good color green and gray would be great.

The fit is good, the denim is lasting and tough, and there's a good selection of colors. And the value can't be beat. The only drawbacks are that the denim doesn't fade that well, and that they are no longer made with the leather tag, which looked much nicer, allowed you to thread your belt through, and reflected a nice attention to detail that's been lost in the recent models.

About six months ago, I ordered TWO pairs of "Regular" fit Lee's -- I have worn them for years, and always loved them. But these jeans were BIG and BAGGY -- hated them, and never wear them. Then, a couple of weeks ago, I ordered TWO MORE "Regular" fit Lee jeans -- SAME THING! Now I realize this is on me, particularly the second time, but either I'm through with LEE, or I might, I said MIGHT, try "Slim" cut, even though I'm not a particularly "Slim" guy -- but I am slim through the hips and have NO REAR END -- so this might be a workaround -- still doesn't mean I'm happy with LEE, because I'm not.

I bought 3 pairs of regular fit straight leg jeans-- 1 blue, 1 brown and 1 black. They all fit well and looked great. My wife loves the fact that I bought the brown and black jeans instead of my usual choice of blue only. I am very happy with my purchase.

As a middle-aged guy who has lived in jeans for 40 odd years, these are the best. I don't want jeans that are big enough for two people and jeans that hang down below my hips. I want jeans that show off the fact that I take the time to stay in shape. Lee Straight Legs are the ticket. If I thought they were going to be changed or discontinued, I'd spend what's left of my 401k and corner the market. Goodbye Gap, hello Lee.

I'm an ecologist and I use these as my field pants. I've got three pairs now. I've tried Carhartt, Mountain Khakis, and other brands that make tough outerwear, but I've found that these Lees do just as well for me. They have the right amount of stretch to not hinder any of my movements, especially when hiking to my study sites. And the denim has held up to brush, dirt, mud, and multiple washes.The straight leg fits over my field boots and rolls up nicely for when I'm working in wet/mucky conditions. I also don't overheat in the summers because they breathe pretty well (much better than canvas!). That being said, they are a little thin for when it's really cold, so I may give the flannel-lined ones a shot.

These are the best fitting jeans for women on the market today. I was MISERABLE with other brands and have searched for years for jeans that have this kind of fit, feel, and wear. I'm finally giving up and buying nothing but these jeans from now on. Yes I know they're for men, but female styles don't fit!

I have been wearing Lee Jeans for over 10 years, I only order them from lee on line because I am consistantly shipped the specific size and no need to try them on. i get about a year and a half of wear out of them. The look good and hold their shape.

I have worn these jeans for many years and if I happen to stumble on a size that works, they are great. However, the listed sizes don't mean anything. Clearly, the people manufacturing them don't know how to use a measuring tape. Over the years, I've discovered that the same size jean can vary by as much as 3 inches at the waist. This means that I have to return as many pair as I buy. Fortunately, if I am lucky enough to get a pair that fit, they will last me for quite some time. But finding the right size is a roll of the dice.

On one of three pair I bought the back pockets are an inch (more?) higher than on the other pairs. They sit very, very, very close to the seam above. Feels odd and awkward using them, and the fit feels strange with anything in the back pockets.. On two of the three pair the back belt loops on one side were offset about an inch differently than the other side. Again feels odd and awkward using them, and makes the pants fit feel off. The value of a product really suffers when something about the product aggravates you.

I had no idea that I could order my Lee jeans direct, until one day out of much frustration in trying to find black Lee jeans in the exact size I wanted, I happened on to the factory web site. As it turns out, with free shipping, I paid only two dollars more per pair than those through another mail order catalog....and in exactly the size and color I wanted....well worth it, and delivery was fast .

When all else failed...LEE JEANS came through. I needed a few pairs of jeans in some color varieties. Well, after both mall and internet searches failed, only LEE came through with color choices. About the only thing I was looking for in addition to the color choices was RELAXED fit in addition to colored jeans. It seems nobody does this anymore. Even LEE did at some time in the past, but no more. Anyway, I went with REGULAR fit. Not my preference, but it somewhat works. Overall, the price was right...the colors were perfect and the shipping was quick. Again, I just wish (maybe as a Christmas wish) they came in REAXED fit to make things 100% perect!!!

Lee Jeans are the best fitting jeans among all the brands. They offer many styles and my favorite are the regular fit , straight leg style. They wear like iron and are the most comfortable. I have tried all the others and Lee jeans are the winners by far.

Could not find 35 waist Lee jeans in any store within a two hundred mile radius of my home and I went to a lot of stores. Visited Lee Jeans site which generated emails and got an email listing a sale so I ordered (4) pair. Thanks so much to Lee, I finally got exactly what I wanted. Thanks.

The jeans were at a fantastic price but I should have gone to a store to try them on first. The regular fit straight leg jeans seem to be so much smaller for their size than the relaxed fit, which is usually what I get but the waist and inseam size was perfect for me so I thought they would fit not problem. Wrong. My mistake & I'll know better next time.

reviewer_headline: Great color Well fitting perfect fit
My kind of jeans for the last 25 years.
So far so good & much better quality than competitor
reviewer_comment: Regular fit with straight leg. 38W x 32L I like these jeans and have been wearing them for many years. Unfortunately most places do not have all the colors, so I have to order them online. The only problem I had this time was that the dark brown pair is 38w x 32L but is actually probably about a 37w x 32L. They are much tighter than bronze pair I received. They are both 38x32, but sizes do not seem to be the same across the color spectrum.

I purchased these jeans for my husband and he absolutely loves them. I got them in 2 different colors and both look great. The only thing is that they are a little shorter than his other jeans that are the marked as the same length. They still look good even if they are a little shorter. I haven't washed them yet so I am hoping they don't shrink otherwise they will be too short.

Jeans received exactly as ordered. Fit perfect, just have to put in hot water. Negative is LEE tab sewn completely in! Change back to old style (Belt will fit through!) Excellent choice of colors but selections limited to website on-hand.... Feels and looks like MEN's jeans vice fad styles!

I have been wearing regular fit straight leg jeans because they seem to fit me the best of any jeans. The fact that Lee has come out with new colors is a real bonus. Recently I bought jeans in the new colors of walnut and thunder and they look great!

I predominately order my jeans online. What I appreciate is that the size (waist and length) never vary from one pair to the next. Thankfully it is not necessary for me to travel to a store to verify the fit. My one recommendation to Lee would be to move the front belt loops a little further away from the fly so that belts with larger buckles can be centered.

My husband has been wearing these jeans for years and loves them because they're made for men over 40....classic fit with a slender straight leg. But when we ordered a new pair recently, we found that the styling had changed. They're wider in the legs now, especially through the thighs, giving them more of a relaxed fit look. (I measured them and the legs are one inch wider now.) They still fit in the waist and seat but the legs look baggy now and remind us of hip-hop style jeans. Ugh!!! He's returning them.

The picture on the web site of jean color does't seem to match the jeans I receive. The color I think taht I have ordered has aways been darker than I would like. But I kept them because it is easier than returning. I like the product style and fit I just can't seem to get the color right.

I have been wearing jeans all my life. The Lee jeans fit my body better than any other brand. The color selection is the best of any brand. They have a stylish tailored fit that compliments your body. They also conform and stretch to your shape very nicely. I am extremely pleased with my recent purchase.

Your quality is good, your price is average to good, the look is good so why the bad review? Because you think all men have at least a 29 inch inseam. I'm sick and tired of all the attention being paid to big and tall while you expect shorter people to roll up their pant legs. I'm 5' 7" but have a short inseam and I'm not alone. My guess is your best selling size is a 30 inch inseam because short people like me have to buy them but would prefer a 28 or even 27 inseam. It's amazing something so simple is such a big issue but it is. If you can't put them in the stores at least make them available on line.

There are many brands of jean that I have purchased that have varying issues. Some rip at the edge of the back pockets, some rip out in the groin area, some even have zipper issues. With these Lee jeans, he experiences none of that. Would highly recommned these for work or casual wear...

I decided to try this company again because my first two orders (LIGHT STONE) were exactly what I ordered. The last two orders were not the color I ordered. LIGHT STONE should not look like a regular BLUE jean. I will not be buying these online again.

High quality jeans at a reasonable price. The regular fit straight leg style is trim looking without being skin tight...Just as I like them. But I wish they were avalilable in shorter inseams (I need to get them altered to 28"), and how about offering a light blue version that doesn't look all beat up.

I've bought and worn some top dollar brand name Jeans but they are either too baggy or the pant length is too long. Lee's Jeans have a variety of colors, styles,and pant length to choose from and the price is very reasonable. I wear these Jeans to work or for casual wear. The only pair of Jeans that actually have a great fit for me are Lee"s.

The value was great, however I was disappointed that the Jeans were not the fit i thought they would be, as the jeans flaired too much at the bottom. I usually buy Guys jeans because the women's do not fit well in the seat & thigh. Also you do not seem to have the size i usually want, ie 32" x 29"

HAVE BEEN WEARING LEVI JEANS FOR OVER 50 YEARS AND LOVE THE PRODUCT BUT THEY CHANGED THE CUT TO BELOW THE WAIST FOR THE 505 REGULAR JEANS. TODAY I BOUGHT MY FIRST PAIR OF LEE JEANS REGULAR FIT PEPPER STONE JEANS...FIT GREAT ABOVE THE WAIST AND THE PRICE YOU COULD NOT BEAT...OUTSTANDING PRODUCT...GEE THEY ACTUALLY FIT..... THANKS..

I love Lee Jeans. But you must be aware. There are two different fabrics in the Regular Fit Straight Leg Jeans. Even though all carry the same "200" + plus "two digits for color" ID, they are not all the same. One is "mid-weight" denim and the other is "heavy-weight" denim. Furthermore, there are two different waist sizes - all marked the exact same. I ordered 8 pair - having return 2 because waist 2 inches smaller. ALSO, it took 10 days from the order to delivery - UPS. This is way too long in today's online market. Even all said - still love Lee Jeans!

I have been buying Lee Regular fit straight leg jeans for over 25 years and I'm going to continue buying them to replace the ones that I wear out. I like the 100% cotton material these jeans are made from and the way they just keep going wash after wash. They are comfortable to wear and last a long time and that is what I am looking for in a pair of jeans.

A little concerned after reading all of these other reviews, but the two pairs I have tried on have fit just fine and they are not identical models. Hopefully the third pair will fit fine too. I bought them without trying them on, just purchased my normal size and they fit fine. I'm new to Lee, but had to find something else because the competitor I had been wearing hasn't had decent quality control for many years and I'm tired of it. I have some of their jeans that are 20 years old and they are still great, but everything since they moved manufacturing overseas has the same sewing/fabric issue with massive off center creasing that looks awful. Neither pair of Lee jeans had this issue so I really hope the quality and fit stays.

My Lee Jeans from previous purchase were perfect. Decided to order more. Taking the number from the tag, I called Lee Jeans to verify ordering correct product. Ordered 3 pair. Same size, same "model" as before. New jeans arrived. Size, compared to old jeans, way too big, in all dimensions. Material/fabric had changed as well. Not as tight of a weave on new jeans. I suspect they will not hold up as well, and the fact that they don't fit correctly means I really can't wear them. Why the product changes? If they are changing the product, shouldn't it have a different number? So dissapointed...

I recently ordered two pairs of pepper prewash jeans, and I am beyond satisfied with the purchase. They are comfortable, nice and thick, and they fit just right. Most importantly, though, they feel very sturdy and like they are made to last. I will continue to wear my Lee jeans with pride, and will most definitely be recommending to friends and family alike.

reviewer_headline: I have been looking for c
I have been buying and we
Finally I can get the colors I want
The brand I grew up wearing, I'm still wearing years later
Great Jeans .. size a bit inconsistent
Quartz color has poor material issues.rear pockets will tear
reviewer_comment: My size ie rarely found in most stores. It has been so easy to order and receive my purchase in less than a week, and they were just what I ordered, and just what I wanted. A good product at a great price. Why would I bother to unsuccessfuly hunt them down in a store, when shopping on line takes only a few minutes, and I immediately know availability. The only way to fly!

Timeless cut, material and construction at excellent value. Comes in multiple light, medium and dark washes, with most 100% cotton - EXCELLENT if you want old school feel and drape! Best to confirm the material of your particular style choice on Lee's own site. If you want dressier dark jeans, I recommend the Ringer color for the deep indigo look, but know it will rub off on your light colored leathers (e.g. wallet, phone case, couch...) for a while if you don't wash it. Stout is also good, with 1% stretch which is minimal enough to feel like a jean and not some hipster legging. No...sizing isn't 100% consistent. But I haven't found a brand that's any better, so what matters here is: Lees are CHEAP, relatively speaking. Buy, try, and no need to cry if it doesn't work out - just donate and try a different style. Want more taper / shorter length? Take to your tailor. Again these are cheap. I appreciate that I can buy a jean that fits my waist and butt (the hardest part to get right) - anything below there is relatively easy to fix. Usually if it fits me up top, it's too tight in the legs. Fabric clinging to my legs and riding up when I sit down? No thanks.

I have recently been experimenting with different jeans trying to find a good fit for me. I have found that these regular fit, straight leg jeans are just what I needed. Having owned "premium" selvedge jeans to Rustler's and Wrangler's I wonder why I hadn't tried these jeans before. I've worn from slim fit jeans to the current "501" with its updated fit. Technically all of the jeans fit me but I felt that they were lacking in one way or another, some fit well in the waist, but saggy in the seat, etc. These are not too relaxed, nor too slim fitting, these feel just right to me. I normally wear a tag size 33 waist in Levi's but size 32 in Lee fit me just right. One thing I have noticed, especially with the colored jeans is that they run a bit short. A tag size 32 length measures just barely 31 on my pair. Not a big deal - size up in length. The Tarmac and Gray colors are so nice, its nice to have some colors in my jean collection.

I have been looking for colored jeans for sometime that were affordable. Saw a Lees jeans commercial on TV -went to their web site and now own 4 pairs of Lee jeans. Like the look, feel and fit. I wear them to work in the office and they look as good as they feel.

I have been buying and wearing daily Lee jeans straight leg regular fit for over fifty years. I recently bought four pair and they are at least one inch bigger in the legs and even though they are marked the length I ordered, they are an inch longer than my existing jeans. They fit more like relaxed fit jeans and I am very dissatisfied.

For some reason Lee jeans have always fit me best.....and for a long time I could not find retailers who would carry colors other than blue or black...finally...my fit...my colors...my brand...all at a very competitive price.... I am buying more as soon as I finish this review

These were my fave go to jeans for years but after ordering several pairs recently, none of them fit!!! Hoe can this be?I contacted Lee and they said the cut of the jeans has been changed. They are sending me a return label....we'll see what happens next. I am really disappointed. I have going to stores and trying stuff on , its a real drag. I hoe they changed the cut back to what it had been for years before!!

My husband has always been a die-hard, loyal customer of another well-known jeans company. I finally convinced him to try Lee because all his jeans are too baggy. Lee's fit better at a much lower cost. He liked them so much that he ordered 3 more pair! He would prefer slim fit, but we can't find any that come up to the waist & have a zipper.

I remember growing up wearing my little Lee jeans, or overalls with my little Justin boots on and feeling great. Didn't realize I'd still be walking around in Justin boots and Lee jeans 30+ years later still feeling just as good. Thought I'd given up wearing trousers/slacks/jeans after serving in the military. Fast forward 11 years, and I went from having nothing but shorts, to now having 7 pairs on these jeans on hand. (Literally just walked through the door from Kohls from picking up two more pairs). Even during the Florida summers, I don't mind tending the horse farm I volunteer at in these jeans. They just fit great where they need to, without bunching up and being baggy.

I recently purchased from your web site three pair (each different color). My local retailers don't carry much of a selection of Lee Jeans. Most of us know that when you walk into a store to buy jeans you pick up several of your size and go to the fitting room to see which one fits. Each one can vary by as much as 1" or more in waist and length. For this reason I've never before ordered jeans online. HEY: all three Lee jeans were the same size, true to size, and fit perfectly. The cut of Lee jeans I already knew to be what I liked over others. I'm floored by this positive buying experience. Thanks!!!

The Lee jean I purchased is Simple, Basic but is also a nice medium heavy denim material. It's what I would call "The Middle of the Road Jean" This pair of jeans you can go out to a party or wear to work around the house, since it is mid-heavy denim. Thank You, Lee

I ordered these for my brother and am more than perplexed that all the men's jeans are 100% cotton and you don't have one pair for women. We don't all want stretch. I want some cotton jeans again. I wore Lee jeans for years (all cotton) and miss them terribly.

I wore the other "L" jeans exclusively since a teenager but the price has gone up while the quality has gone down. After being disappointed for the last time a few years ago, I bought a couple pair of LEE jeans and now I am a total convert. The quality is excellent and the price is fair. I'm a carpenter so I go thru jeans quickly but the LEE's that I have been wearing have stood the test of time. It's also been quite a while since I have felt good about wearing jeans for other than work. Thank you LEE !!!

I have been a customer of "The Other" jean manufacturer for more years than I care to remember. I don't know what they did, but nothing they have fits me anymore. I thought I'd give "Lee" a try, and am I glad I did. My first order was for 2 pair just to check the fit. I then ordered 3 more pair, these jeans fit just the way they should. Lee please don't change a thing, you'll have a customer for life.

In an earlier time this 5th pocket was also called a watch pocket but I have always used this pocket for my coin change. In the Lee jeans I bought 3 or 4 years ago this pocket was both wider and shallower and was excellent for carrying coins. It is now too deep and too narrow for this purpose. Since this pocket is not in any of my other pants it's poor design more than out weighed by all of the things I like about my Lee jeans.

I haven't worn a pair of Lee jeans since the early 80's. Our physical changes make it appear less of a fashion statement. I've gone through a change in my life where I lost thirty pounds. I thought I should try out a pair of Lee jeans. I got tired of the other brands and I was surprised to find out that Lee jeans still make a quality product. The regular fit was just right!!

Great jeans and great color selections, but waist size a bit inconsistent. I bought a 32 waist before, it was a bit loose. So went to a local store and tried on a 31, fit perfect. Bought the 31 with the color I wanted online, but the waist was too tight.

I have worn Lee jeans for 40 years. Now Lee has changed the cut on their regular fit jeans. Lee used to be the jeans that fit, now their the jeans that don't fit. This new cut is very loose and baggy. Levi did this same thing about 18 years ago. It would be nice to have a pair of the old Lee Riders

I bought 6 pair of the quartz jeans style 2008934 in October. all have tears in the rear pockets already. called cust service and they were aware of the issue with this style. offered to replace all 6 pair, but suggested I change the color. they said the material was purchased from a 3rd party and is not up to Lee standards. Forms for warranty on their way, we'll see. But so far sounds like Lee is going to stand behind their product. It will take 3-6 weeks, so time will tell. Ill let you know what happens.

I have been buying Lee jeans in regular fit and relaxed fit for 15 years. Lee Jeans fit my physique better than any other on the market. The only problems I have encountered are not being able to get all the colors in stores in my area, especially the light tan, which I wear for work a lot, and the light tan jeans have the same belt loop that tears out the same place on only the light tan jeans. I probably have 10 pair that I can't wear anymore because that loop tore out. Other than that I love them.
product_name: Pacific Foods Organic Bone Broth, Turkey, 32 fl oz

reviewer_headline: I am SO glad I found these jeans!
I was pleased to find men
reviewer_comment: Quoting my husband, "The jeans are just right in the seat and leg. Usually I have a problem with the legs being to baggy. Quality and thickness of the material is just what I was looking for in a jean. It's not the thin designer jean material it's an everyday jean."

I have been buying these jeans for years and don't wear any other kind. The reduced stars were caused by one pair I got recently that was labeled the same as my usual style and size but it turned out to be looser and about an inch longer than the rest. Don't know why. Overall, I'm very pleased by the product and Lee's service.

We bought these online direct from Lee. 8 pairs total. 5 to replace outside work jeans in Aztec and 3 for casual evenings out in different colors like green/grey, tan and light tan. Great fit and perfect for work and play. My husband isn't one to wear dressy clothes and these are a step up from regular jeans.

For two years I searched the stores for the style and size I wanted. Zero luck. It seems that when a man's waist size goes to 40, the stores think we're not worth it, or we hardly exist. So reluctantly I went online, very leery of buying jeans I couldn't try on first, and took a chance on these. Pay dirt! And there are so many colors to choose from. They fit great and the price is right.

Great Price and great fit. My son is tall and lean. Very hard to find his size of jeans (31 x 34) in the department stores. No problem ordering directly for this web site. Got the jeans just a few days later, plus I also received free shipping on my order, every penny counts at Christmas time. I will definetly be back to place future orders. You have my business from now on...

I love Lee Jeans. There fit is better than other brands and they last forever. My only complaint is for the non blue colors I have no clue what the colors are. What color is thunder? Make it easy on us for the non-blue shades just tell us what color they are online so we can order online and not have to ship them back.

I have been buying Lee jeans for years because I like the fit of the Regular style. However, my recent purchases have revealed a problem with leg inseam length. The dark colored jeans have always come with the length specified. But the tan colored jeans were up to an inch short. Lee customer service was very good and refunded my payment when they said that they could not guarantee the specified length for the "special" dyes. So I will have to find a retail store where I can measure the length before buying the tan jeans.

Jeans were great Lee quality material and fit, but pair shipped was at least 2 inches shorter than the size ordered. They were unusable -- thus the low rating. Had they been the length ordered (and shown on the tag), I would have given this item five stars.

I have worn several different brands of jeans but in my experience these are the best jean brand for me. Anything else ends up not fitting the right way and ends up hanging on the rack never to be worn. So if your tall and thin, lee will fit ya just right. Plus the ladies will like ya for it, and ya don't have to raid ya piggy bank. Take it from me, I know these things. You want a good dependable pair of jeans that you will look good in, leave it to lee.

I've worn Lee jeans exclusively ever since emigrating to this country in 1968. The fit has always been good, the material durable and the look just splendid. I'm always telling friends I'd make a commercial for Lee jeans gratis. "Lee-the one for me."

I was pleased to find men's colored Lee jeans available, once again. Lee jeans have always equaled Levi and other labels for quality but Lee is more reasonably priced. These jeans are beautiful and really enhance a wardrobe, providing the durability and comfort of denim in attractive fashion colors. A solid 5-star item!

I returned this product. I was disappointed in the color. I purchased your tan jeans about four or five years ago and they were great. They were a lighter tan color and I was hoping that they were the same shade. The fabric was also more in a smooth weave, not as course as your regular jeans. The color is my primary concern though not the material. I only wear Lee Jeans and love your products. I hope in the your future product planning that Lee will offer the tan Jeans in the lighter shade.

I originally came across these because I was looking for a good brown pair of jeans online. Not beige, not tan, not khaki, but brown. Turns out that not only was Lee Jeans the best game in town, they were the ONLY company offering true brown jeans in mens' sizes, (I was also looking for a good brown too, but shockingly Lee has stopped making jean jackets altogether). I'm happy to say that not only did they get the color right, but the fit, quality, value and material are all first-rate! A month ago I was a Levi's man. Now, all my new jeans from here on are Lee's.

I have worn Lee classic fit straight leg jeans for years. They always fit great. I have noticed they are a little bigger in the hips and thighs then they used to be. I don't like that. But my biggest issue is that on size 33 waist and smaller they have reduced the number of belt loops from 7 to 5. That causes your belt to ride up above your jeans and looks and feels terrible... Please add the 2 belt loops back to the smaller size jeans. Thanks

I've lost 40 pounds over the last year and when I put on my Wrangler jeans and compared them to my well worn Lee's it was abundantly clear which was the better product. The Lee's fit the way jeans I wear are supposed to fit; the other guys were just baggy. The specs were supposedly identical for both. Lee are the best all day long.

About 3 purchases back the seat and thighs became very baggy. My wife has to cut the seam from knee to crotch to knee and take in 1.25" at the crotch and resew. Wish I knew if there was a fit that would save us doing this. Otherwise better material quality than the paper thin Levis.

Although I like the color and Lee has always been one of my favorite Jean brands, I am a little disappointed at the narrowness of the "Regular fit". It is more of a Slim fit compared to other brands who offer the same cut. I think it's a matter of preference so I will order their "Relaxed Fit" the next time.

I went to countless stores trying on jeans at all price points!, I finally realized the best fitting pair was already in my closet! My 33-32 Regular Fit Lee's were comfortable and fit in all the right places. Went to the site to find cool colors that were not in the store (Quartz & Bronze washes) With the $ I saved I bought some boots!

I've worn Lee jeans for a long time, mainly because of the good fit, but the last few purchases have been disappointing because of wear problems in the right rear "wallet" pocket. A hole wore through in 2 pair that I bought just 6 months ago. Don't know whether it is because of cheaper material or what, but it seems one should get better wear than that. Otherwise they are great jeans.

I have been wearing these "TAN" jeans since Lee has been making them. I wear them until I totally wear them out and all the color is gone out of them. I have never wore anything more comfortable than these. I recently went online to order these because all the stores stopped carrying them. I ordered and received three pairs. I am dismayed to find that one of the belt loops on the back has torn out of the fabric. On another pair that same loop has started to go. I just went on line and see in your pictures that the loops in question no longer appear--there are fewer belt loops in your ad and the one on the back is shown on the seem. So, what is the story here? Has the design been changed? Is the weight of the fabric less and that is why they tear out? I will keep wearing them for there are no others. (We have repaired them.)
product_name: Pacific Foods Organic Bone Broth, Turkey, 32 fl oz

reviewer_headline: I have 9 of the Straight Jean 20089443232 Pepper Stonewash
Nice jeans, but not true to size
best fitting, worst wearing jeans ever
Cut has changed! TOO BIG IN HIPS!
reviewer_comment: The fit and comfort are excellent and having 9 Straight Jean 20089443232 Pepper Stonewash and 3 of the Pepper Prewash (Dark Denim) (2008989) I have enough to keep in a good rotation for long term wear. The weight of the Denim is heavy, but comfortable. A huge benefit is the consistency of Fit. Many times jeans of the same style fit different pair to pair - not Lee's every pair fits the same.

We read the reviews and thought that these would fit him better. The waist is great and the length but the legs are so much wider then what we thought. I guess you just don't make them the way you use too. We will have to look for slim for those men sho don't have much of a butt.

I bought a pair of the Ringer regular fit jeans and they have this very strong smell. I didn't notice it until I was getting ready to wash them the first time. It's hard to describe but it reminds me of a black permanent marker. I have washed them several times but the smell is still there and it was picked up by the other jeans I washed them with.

I was been buying the same size Lee jeans for years. My weight has not changed. These recent jeans don't fit the same as the former jeans did. They are looser at the seat and thighs, and they made the watch pocket smaller. They are not as comfortable as the old style. Bring back the old style.

I purchased the regular fit straight leg Lee Jeans for 2 reasons. The first is that they offer a 31 inch inseam jean which is what I like, not 30 inch (too short) or 32 (too long) like other jean manufacturers. Second, they fit perfectly not being bulky, again like other manufacturers. In addition they are a great value. This comes after wearing another major jean manufacturer for years that i was not totally satisfied with, especially after they stopped selling a 31 inch inseam jean. Lee has my vote!

Ordered regular fit straight leg jeans in a classic stonewash color. They came alot darker than I expected and what the picture showed. They actually look closer to the lead stonewash. I was very disappointed in them. I bought them for work and will wear them anyway rather than go through the hassel of returning them but will probably not order online again because of it.

I always buy Lee for my husband. They fit him the best of any jeans. They are his favorite and come in a variety of colors. He works in a professional yet casual atmosphere and the colored jeans allow for him to look and feel polished. I just bought three pairs as part of his Christmas present! He'll love them.

I really liked the color/wash of these jeans and was very disappointed that the size was not true. I ordered the size that my husband wears for jeans, dress slacks and suits. I guess he is just a standard size as all pants labeled his size fit (unlike ladies sizes...I can wear XL to a M depending on brand) - and I always thought that since men's sizes were based on measurements that they would be true. These jeans were waaaaaay too tight, not even close to being able to zip and button comfortably.

This pair of Lee jeans is 3 inches smaller in the waist than the other 4 pair of the same size Lee jeans that I purchased in the past year. Now I have to make special trip to the post office to return them at my expense. What a waste of time and money!

I recently purchased these jeans to replace a worn out pair that I've had for a prolonged time. I've been wearing Lee jeans for approximately 7-10 years, after moving from another "L" brand that no longer fit or "felt" the same. The first thing I noted was the fit; much looser than what I was used to. Secondly, the "feel" of the fabric was much softer than what I was used to in the past. Not bad, just different. I have to presume that Lee decided to change the fit and the fabric composition somewhat over time and I was unaware of this change. I've been wearing a jean made with a heavier(stiffer?) fabric and the "softer touch" threw me off. I have since learned that I've been wearing Style # 2008989 and just purchased Style# 2008940, thus the difference. I had to go to www.Lee.com to find this out. But in defense of Lee, their customer communication was excellent. Now that I know what "style" to buy, I will continue to purchase Lee products. It should be noted that after making Lee aware of my concerns,they volunteered to accept a return and even sent out a postage paid return label for the package. NICE GOING, Lee!! Not used but much appreciated!

Bought a pair of Lee Straight quartz stone in the store. Best looking, best fitting, most comfortable jeans I ever owned. Went back to buy more, and they were out. Bought 6 pair on line. They started falling apart immediately. First 2-3 washings, they started ripping out at the top of the back pockets. Put patches in all of them at that spot, even the ones still intact. Now two of them are ripping along the back pockets.

I have used these jeans forever. However, with the most recent order, I found that lee has changed the cut for this model number and now makes it much larger in the hips and thighs than it used to be. It looks baggy and empty in the large legs where it used to be close fit and fit my smaller frame. It is a shame that such a classic cut had to be changed. Lee's "slim" cut line is preworn and seems to be geared to younger men.

I had four pair of Lee Jeans and just ordered two more. They are great, only problem is you guys did away with the "sand" color. Would like a light color to replace my sand color which are worn out. I bought a pair of "dune" which are fine, but would like a lighter color. Only complaint is your order pictures on line are too hard to tell the actual color. I now have two Rex's. But the jeans themselves are GREAT.....

I haven't been a big jeans fan until I started a new job that allows me to wear jeans. Lee's jeans are right for me. I'm not into fad's, I just like the straight leg style but Lee's has style, quality, comfort, selection and are value priced. It has been a long time since I bought jeans and I had put on weight since my last purchase. Retail stores only had my style jeans in two colors. I was very pleased to find the website offered about 6 various colors in my size. Don't change a thing, I like it the way it is. Lee's are for me.

My husband has worn this particular style of jeans for over 25 years. It's very obvious after our last purchase in Jan 2011 that there have been several changes in the style of the jean. The pockets are not the same, and they just don't fit as well as the identical jeans we purchased about 6 months ago. FYI... he has worn the same size for years, so that's not an issue. Change is not always good...

have' nt tried lee for many years. thought they were kinda for cowboys. i'm glad i decided to give them a try. the regular fit straight leg is slimmer than other brands i've worn for years. thats a plus for me as i'm on the thin side. fits great and looks great. i bought 12 different colors and they all are great. very satisfied. price, selection and fit all first rate. fast service a plus too. did i mention my son thought they are pretty cool.

I had been buying Levi 505 jeans since 1969. Since they are no longer made I tried several different jeans and decided on Lee regular and I'm glad I did. The look and feel are great and the price was fantastic. Thank you Lee, you made my changeover very easy

I knew what waist and inseam I wanted, so I was able to get it without driving to different stores to find what was in stock. The jeans fit like I want, although all jeans in my waist size are a little baggy in the seat because of my flat rear. My only disappointment was the leather Lee patch is sewn shut. I've been threading my belt under the patch since 1954.

I ordered and received two pairs. On one pair the outside seam on one leg is off, it starts at the hip and ends up at the middle of the foot. This makes the leg look twisted. Unfortunately I did not notice this until the second wash. Better quality control could prevent things like this. Other than that they are good Jeans.

This product has been a favorite of mine for forty plus years. The quality, fit and durability has been unsurpassed by any other jean I've tried. I've come to rely on this Lee product to provide my complete satisfaction each time I purchase it. The on line procedure is easy and quick...I usually receive the products within 3-5 days.
product_name: Pacific Foods Organic Bone Broth, Turkey, 32 fl oz

reviewer_headline: The best you can get in america
One fits one's way to small
Excellent value on size not found in stores
reviewer_comment: I'm on the trim side I would have given Lee Jeans a 5+ if they offered these jeans in a Trim Size. 1-2 inches smaller in the seat and thigh area.Their Trim Size is the same size as their regular fit jeans. However these are nice jeans overall. Have a great choice of colors and the quality is better than must.

I have been a wait 30 for so many years. 30" is not a matter of opinion, it is a measurement. I recieved 2 pairs size 30 and could hardly buckle them. They were more like a 29 at most. I paid to have them shipped back for 31. They arrived and they are still very snug. There is hardly a difference between the size. Surely not a ful inch. Yes they are affordable, stylish and comfortable, except for the waist. I'm now going to have to pay to send one pair back again. In YOUR size chart I will need a 32 if I am going to tuck in a winter shirt.

I love Lee Jeans. The quality and fit couldn't be better. But.....I would like the color descriptions to be better. Colors are not always true on various computers (depending on your color adjustments.) And it is hard to determine for example if some names are shades of blue, gray, or dark brown. Delta, or quartz, are not colors exactly. So you are not sure if you are looking at a shade of dark blue or dark gray. Otherwise, The large selection of colors that stores do not carry is great. jsfrnk

I was a Levi customer for more than 40 years. They changed the fit of the Regular Fit jeans. They shortened the waist and I could not stand the way that they sat low on my waist and encouraged "plumbers butt". I felt like I always wanted to pull the pants up although they wouldn't go any higher. Thank you for having a "regular fit" jeans. I am sure that more Levi customers will move to Lee once they find out you have the correct fit.

have all the nice features. They are availabe in inseams shorter than 30". In fact they are the only mfgr, that does. The belt loops are the right size and space just right. Pockets are the right size. The jeans have a nice soft feel yet hold up extremely well. Great value!!!!

I tried a lot of jeans in america and I could not find a good cut. All of them had this baggy cut where I felt I could fit two people like me inside them. I remember my dad wearing lee jeans back in 1970's and I said I should try to find Lee in USA. The best jeans for a guy who is not small and who is not too big.

Having tried other major brands with little success, I saw a Lee's ad and visited their web site.. Having never ordered jeans online, I decided to try a single pair to see if the looks and fit were what I wanted.. They were and I intend to order more. Not having a Robert Redford "bod", I am hard to please, but I think these will work fine..

i have worn lee jeans for over forty years. i like the style's the fit and the comfort. i worked in the auto industry and never was fond of the coveralls i had excess to. in my early years i wore the stovepipe or boot leg cut. thanks for making it easy to order on line

I have worn lee jeans for 25 years. I had not bought jeans for 3 years because I had plenty. Time to replenish my supply. After going to numerous stores and trying on numerous lee jeans I found that the thighs in all there regular fir jeans were a good couple inches larger. I even tried the slim fit only to find they were also bigger than the regular fit was. What happend please bring back the old cut. And I tried classic and same thing they are a lot more baggy. Iam vary disappointed.

Great , easy ordering, great operator, quick delivery. Easier than going to a store. I have always been a Lee jeans guy, I'm tall and thin and I find Lee's fit the best. I do see the difference the color makes concerning fit. The light blue are baggier than the dark blue and the stone I purchased fit the best (slim), mostly around the thighs. Over all very satisfied with this shopping experience!

I was required to wear light-colored pants while working as a manager at a big-box home improvement retailer, but I wanted something that would wear well because I'd be climbing and crawling throughout the store. I tried five pair of these jeans in tarmac and wore them for 3 years. These jeans are like steel and have lasted well beyond my tenure there. Since they're just now starting to look somewhat rough, I've ordered two more pair. They fit perfectly and seem to last forever. Highly recommended.

So close to being satisfied, but NOT. These jeans look great and fit great north of the knees. But a key reason I bought this style specifically was for the 16" leg opening. When I received them, they were 18"! I frigging hate that! I get that some people like that and there are styles for them. But these specifically said 16". That's not manufacturing variance; that's just wrong.

I was excited to get a new pair of jeans through the mail instead of going out to a store and all that shopping involves. The first time I tried on my jeans the belt loop broke as I was pulling them on. Then I noticed that they did not fit the same as the previous 2 pairs that I purchased.

Material is good. Color is good. Fit is good if you don't wash. If you wash, then you'll need to give them to Good Will. The waist shrinks about 2 inches. Really disappointed. I liked the material and color but they don't fit. Next time I'll order a larger size and maybe they'll shrink down to a nice fit!

I'm been buying Lee Jean for over 50 years and have found that your jeans have had exceptional value. I prefer sand colored jeans but I can't find them in my local stores so I purchased three for the first time on line. I was satisfied with the price which would be what I paid in my local store but it was only offered in a leg length of 30 where my size was 29. It appears that these were of inferior quality for the first pair split after one washing, some thing that I've never experienced before.

I have been buying Lee regular fit jeans for years and have been very satisfied,how ever the last several times I tried to buy some the length is about 2 inches to long I have always bought waist 30 and inseam 32 with no problem. I thought it was just the stock in one store but I tried three different stores and they all fit the same to long.please have the manufacturer check their tape measure thank you

I purchased two pair of jeans both the same size, the heavy weight jeans fit great however the medium weight jeans aren't even close to fitting, way too small. Tryed on the pair that fit first and took the tages off both pair now I'm stuck with them.

The Lee Regular Fit Straight Leg Jeans I purchased (two pair) were delivered quickly, fit well, and met all expectations. Purchasing was easy on-line, and the delivery schedule was on-time. This is an excellent value and so much easier than schlepping off to the store. The size I need (40x29) is usually never found in any store. I will definitely return to purchase here again.

This style was the best fit for me. Now my waist became bigger, so I ordered the same style with "current waist X old length". Unfortunately the length doesn't fit me any more. So I had to exchange it. Anyways, Lee has very good customer service and this brand is highly recommended.

I love Lee jeans. I have been buying them from retail stores all my life. This was the first pair I bought online. I did so because I wear a very common size and usually find that the stores are out of them unless I just happen to be there within a day or two of a new shipment. The only problem I had was the fit. I'm a 32-32, but what I received seemed to be more of a 32.5 - 33. They are a little loose and long, but not unacceptable. I tried to shrink them but they come pre-shrunk (I guess). I won't return them, but if I buy online again I will probably order a 31-31 or maybe a 32-31. Overall, they are a great pair of jeans.
product_name: Pacific Foods Organic Bone Broth, Turkey, 32 fl oz

reviewer_headline: Regular straight legs vs. stone ground
Fit like jeans used to fit
reviewer_comment: I've been wearing Lee jeans for over thirty years. Won't change anytime soon. Lee has the most comfortable fit available. The cut of the jeans, regular and comfort, is far superior to others. Lee has the most reasonable prices for their jeans I can find.

This was a great way to buy jeans. I can never find the right size in the stores. You had a choice in my size. The fit was perfect. The jeans were delivered right on time and in perfect condition. I will continue to buy my jeans from you and will recommend your company to all of my friends. Thank you

Found the Regular Fit Straight Leg pepper stone wash Jean to not fit as nicely (on my shape) as the classic stone wash jeans. Would've ordered classic (which I've been ordering for a long time), but they were out of stock so I thought I'd try the others. I sent them back. Don't get me wrong. These jeans are the same high quality as other Lee jeans, they just fit a little looser than I like.

These jeans look great usually fit very good. I have 5-6 pair and I received 1 pair that fits a little looser and one that fits a little more snug but this is not a major problem. These jeans are very comfortable and fit much better than Levi's or Wrangler! Plus there are alot of colors to choose from ! Look no futher these are the best jeans on the market !

Smooth all the way around. The website is easy to navigate, and the ordering process is simple. The order was processed immediately and the jeans arrived quickly. And my new Lee jeans fit perfectly. I cannot imagine a better overall online shopping experience.

We were looking for a particular color and chose one too dark but they will do for now. Medium weight and would like it heavier but they are comfortable and stylish. They have the belt loops we need and not minus loops like some. Will drfinitely order again. Great price. Did not have to run all over town.

I have been wearing Lee Jeans most of my life. I love their fit and finish. Also I am a conservative and want the style and features to remain the same as the last 35 plus years. Details such as the curve stitching on the back pockets, and the leather or man made LEE patch should not change. I did notice that the last two pair I purchased change was made. They came with the LEE patch sewn all the way around, I can't put my belt under the Leather.

My husband was not blessed with a rear end. However these jeans make his back side very appealing. The legs fit great and the waist is the best fit . He says he will not wear any other jeans after wearing these. Even I love to look at him in these...and I m very hard to please. Thank God for LEE JEANS.

I had worn Lee"s years ago and had forgotten how good they fit. Bought one pair a while back online and then it hit me what I had been missing was just a good jean that really fit right and the price was good as well. Have placed 3 orders now. Buying online you have more of a choice than in the stores in my opinion. They're always out of my size or color but online you get exactly what you want. Takes less than a week to get em. I buy only the regular straight leg style and have not been disappointed.

I'm 66 years old and I have been waring this style and brand of jeans for about 10 years and have been very satisfied with the way they fit, look and feel the fit is obsolutely great they never fall and give you a diaper butt look Like many other brands do, I may be 66 years old, but I still have some scroupols.

I used to wear LEE Regular fit straight leg jeans for a last 10 years. Model 20089 is really perfect, not too loose, not too tight, very comfortable. Just received two new pairs in a "new colors". Jeans are really good - the same fit and quality, new comfortable stretch fabrics, stylish look with new attractive details like double-color stitching, new styles of labels and rivets and LEE label at the back pocket. Great thanks to LEE for reissuing classic fit jeans with modern stylish details.

I have been buying Lee's Regular Fit Jeans for years, as I do find them more comfortable and a better value than Levi's. What has gotten frustrating, however, is the increasing (it seems) variations within the same cut and size. For example, usually my 32X29/30 fit pretty well around the thigh, but my most recent jeans I ordered seem significantly more baggy in the thighs. And some are narrower at the ankle (which I like), but most are wider. Some fit my waist fine, others are tight. In short, there seems to be little relative consistency in the same size. Perhaps the answer is to pay a little more and try the jeans on in stores rather than order on line. The selection in stores, however, is far more limited.

The legs are a bit more loose than my old straight fits[2008920], loose enough to make them feel almost baggy. They're comfy though, I gotta admit that. The waist is perfect, compared to my old ones'. So if you could combine this waist with the leg fit of the 2008920's, it would be perfect.

My son wears a 29" waist and a 32" inseam. You have no idea how hard it is to find jeans in that size. Plus, if you CAN find them, they cost a fortune and probably won't look that good on him. The Lee jeans not only come in his size, but they fit great, look good, and are very affordable. I think over the last year or so, I've purchased about six pairs for him. I absolutely love them!

I really am not impressed with these jeans. I want my old classic style back but they were discontinued. I like the rugged working style jeans. I ride Harley's and horses. I don't want a Jean that's going to fail on me at the first sign of hard work. I want a Jean that's going to take a stone to the shin at 75mph and not tear a huge gash in the pants or my leg. These jeans are NOT it.

I was very dissappointed with one particular item on my last purchase. The colors that are shown on the sample are not the colors that the items actually are. You have two lighter colors in the item I purchased. Sand and dune. I already purchased the sand color a few times in the past but was wishing they were lighter then they actually were on the sample. This time I looked at the dune color and it looked closer to a whiter color which is what I wanted. When they arrived, they were actually darker then the sand and that dissappointed me very much. Also, I wish they would come in a 28 length which they do not.

I love the way Lee jeans fit me. I just wish there had been some words to try to describe the colors. Everyone knows how colors look different on different monitors and to only use one word to describe a color is not helpful. I didn't order "Sand" because it looked very light and slightly yellow, so I ordered "Dune" which looked almost identical on screen but just a tinge darker. Well it's MUCH darker than what my screen showed. "Walnut" I thought would be a rich dark brown but it's a little washed out-looking. And I really wonder what "Bronze" looks like! On screen it just looks like Black. Hey Lee, if you want me to help you write descriptions, just send me one of every color, in my size, and I'll write great descriptions for you.

Been buying Lee regular fit for ages but this past year I couldn't find the right fit with the same style so I ordered them. Exact same style is now baggy and loose and I DON'T LIKE IT. Now I have to start all over with checking out other brands to find the tight fit I'm comfortable with. Thanks Lee!

The problem with Lee jeans is that after washed for a few months, the hem starts unraveling and small white holes appear in the seams. Also Lee should make the length in odd sizes also like in the past such as 31", 33" etc. I have to buy a 34" which is really too long, but yet a 32" is too short.
