Been wearin them since I was 5
i would not buy again until the old cut is back
I order these jeans for m
reviewer_comment: I use these jeans as a daily non work pants. I am most happy in terms of its fit and then secondly the price. ****Fit: I have almost no butt and these jeans match that area (seat) well- - most other jeans are baggy everywhere!!I have literally been looking here and there for a few months. most stores here don't have this brand. Once I finally came across this brand and style- my long search was over ! Exciting! To be fair I've worn these three days but I don't expect them to change.

For some reason I love this brand and style of jeans (and exactly double black color), and once I realized that haven't been buying any other type over last two years, I decided to buy a few of them online. It's nice that I (hope I) can rely on the fact that I'll be able to buy exactly the same type in the future. Retail shops often don't have certain types or certain sizes. They fit nicely, they look cool. The color and texture is somewhat unique. They are indistinguishable from black pants if you look from distance, so you can wear them with a shirt and a jacket, but you get all benefits of jeans too: you don't have to iron them! :) Definitely a good choice for someone who doesn't want to spend much time and money, but still want to look nice. Also, arrived quickly, delivery time above my expectations.

These and Express thin, straight leg jeans are the only ones that fit me well. I've tried nearly ever brand in the last month. 6'1'' with around 31 waist in dress pants (32-33 for this Lee style - 32.5 would probably be perfect. I'm wearing these in 32 now and it's very snug). Probably about 1 to 1.5 sizes smaller in waist than standard fitted suit pant. The leg does not look too baggy at the knee down, but end up too tight around the crotch like most brands/styles. These were a bit slimmer than my old Lee "relaxed", which fit well because of the tapered leg. However, the "relaxed" became too baggy for me when they recently changed the styling over last year or two. These have a very nice look in the Quartz and Bronze stone wash.

Good value, price, fit and style. Wish they did not wear out as quickly. Seem to be prone to tearing in the crotch after several months use. Wish the new "Heavy weight fabric" was really just that. Jeans are much thinner than they used to be, especially the "Lead Stonewash - Heavyweight Jean". Overall I still will keep buying.

I've always, always worn Lee jean (40 plus years). I would buy serveral at a time and break in the new one's slowly as the older ones wore out or turned into RAGS. I've recently exhausted my supply and have been searching for the 'old' style fit and after return after return I finally called LEE corporate and asked if they changed something. They said they changed their regular fit to be more roomy in the seat and thigh . WHY ?? I'm now in a search for a jean with the old LEE fit. Why couldn't you have left good enought alone and came out with another fit, like regular fit with addded room !! or how about 'relaxed fit' I don't need to be lookin like a fool with my pants on the ground. Adio's LEE Jeans .

I always loved Lee jeans because they fit me so well. I really liked my purchase and all but the only problem I have is that on one of my three pairs the length was one size longer than the other two. I wish they would have all come in the correct length.

I've been wearin Lee's since I was 5 years old, quality hasn't changed. They're still the durable, do-anything, go-anywhere jeans I used to enjoy. They just look a lot better on me now because my mom isn't the one picking them for me. I love you mom, but you have no sense of style.

I recently purchased three pair with 29" inseam and none of the three measured 29" and for that matter all three measured differently. The other disappointment I have is the denim weight appears to get less and less and therefore as work jeans wearout occurs a lot faster than they used to especially in the knees!

Not even close, much darker and brown than what I had hoped.. I also ordered the Battleship color thinking it would be grey but it is almost more of a grey/green than a true grey. I ordered the Light stone expecting it to be light blue and it was more of a regular darker denim tone. Live and learn.

this continues to be the best source for a product i've worn for a lifetime. the color, fit and durability over the years has not changed and being able to have them delivered to my door is more than just an added plus.
Again I have to say thanks to Lee Jeans for providing me with a great pair of pants!!. The cost is GREAT! the fit is fantastic!! best fitting brand of jeans I have ever tried.
